channel.title: Application background won't load

item.title: Application background won't load
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

He is using the tutorials I created.

This all works for me, and repaint(); is called so it can obviously repaint. It won’t show any movement of anything if you do not call it. Plus I have tried complex images with the way he is trying and it works fine for me. So I am not sure why that happens with his.

Read full topic

item.title: Application background won't load
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:23, topic:291145”][quote author=ownagesbot link=topic=384864.msg2888893#msg2888893 date=1248778213]
Looks like you fixed it, but you could have done:

getContentPane().setColour(r,g,b); iirc.
[/quote]

Yes, I fixed the background. However, my images are loading extremely slow. There should be 2 blocks, one at X: 10 Y: 50, and one aswell at X: 290 Y: 150.[/quote]

Are you sure they are loading slowly, or is it just taking forever for the application to render? Or rather, is it taking forever for the application to get around to rendering it?

Read full topic

item.title: Application background won't load
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Both paint and paintComponent are in BulletWarsMain:

[code] public void paint(Graphics gr) {
image = createImage(getWidth(), getHeight());
graphics = image.getGraphics();

	paintComponent(graphics);
	gr.drawImage(image, 0, 0, null);
	repaint();

}

public void paintComponent(Graphics gr) {
	player1.draw(gr);
	player1.update(1);
	player2.draw(gr);
	player2.update(2);
	
}[/code]

If you want the whole class:

[code]package chassy13;

import java.awt.Color;
import java.awt.Graphics;
import java.awt.Image;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyListener;

import javax.swing.JFrame;

public class BulletWarsMain extends JFrame implements KeyListener {

/**
 * 
 */
private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
private PlayerHandler player1;
private PlayerHandler player2;
public Image image;
private Graphics graphics;
private boolean player1Up = false;
private boolean player1Down = false;
private boolean player2Up = false;
private boolean player2Down = false;


public BulletWarsMain() {
	setTitle("Bullet Wars - 2D - Version 1.0");
	setResizable(false);
	addKeyListener(this);
	setSize(500, 300);
	setBackground(Color.BLACK);
	setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
	
	
	player1 = new PlayerHandler(10, 150, 20, 90, 10, "Images/p1.gif");
	player2= new PlayerHandler(290, 150, 20, 90, 10, "Images/p2.gif");
	
	setVisible(true);		
}

public void paint(Graphics gr) {
	image = createImage(getWidth(), getHeight());
	graphics = image.getGraphics();
	
	paintComponent(graphics);
	gr.drawImage(image, 0, 0, null);
	repaint();

}

public void paintComponent(Graphics gr) {
	player1.draw(gr);
	player1.update(1);
	player2.draw(gr);
	player2.update(2);
	
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
	new BulletWarsMain();

}

public PlayerHandler getPlayer1() {
	return player1;
}

public void setPlayer1(PlayerHandler player1) {
	this.player1 = player1;
}

public PlayerHandler getPlayer2() {
	return player2;
}

public void setPlayer2(PlayerHandler player2) {
	this.player2 = player2;
}

@Override
public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e) {
	if(e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_UP) {
		player2Up = true;
	}else if(e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_DOWN) {
		player2Down = true;
	}else if(e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_W) {
		player1Up = true;
	}else if(e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_S) {
		player1Down = true;
	}
}

@Override
public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e) {
	if(e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_UP) {
		player2Up = false;
	}else if(e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_DOWN) {
		player2Up = false;
	}else if(e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_W) {
		player1Up = false;
	}else if(e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_S) {
		player1Down = false;
	}
	
}

@Override
public void keyTyped(KeyEvent e) {
	
}

public void setPlayer1Up(boolean player1Up) {
	this.player1Up = player1Up;
}

public boolean isPlayer1Up() {
	return player1Up;
}

public void setPlayer1Down(boolean player1Down) {
	this.player1Down = player1Down;
}

public boolean isPlayer1Down() {
	return player1Down;
}

public void setPlayer2Up(boolean player2Up) {
	this.player2Up = player2Up;
}

public boolean isPlayer2Up() {
	return player2Up;
}

public void setPlayer2Down(boolean player2Down) {
	this.player2Down = player2Down;
}

public boolean isPlayer2Down() {
	return player2Down;
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Application background won't load
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[code]package chassy13;

import java.awt.Graphics;
import java.awt.Image;
import java.awt.Toolkit;

public class PlayerHandler extends Objects {

public PlayerHandler(final int xPos, final int yPos, final int width, final int height, final int health, final String img) {
	this.xPos = xPos;
	this.yPos = yPos;
	this.height = height;
	this.width = width;
	this.img = getImage(img);
	this.health = health;
}

@Override
public void draw(Graphics gr) {
	gr.drawImage(img, xPos, yPos, width, height, null);	
}

@Override
void update(final int id) {
	if(id == 1) {
		
	} else if (id == 2) {
		
	}
}

@Override
Image getImage(String img) {
	return Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(img);
}

}[/code]

item.title: Application background won't load
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Ahh. Well I changed the method names to paint and paintComponent, and now it will paint black. The images will still not load though.

[code] public void paint(Graphics gr) {
image = createImage(getWidth(), getHeight());
graphics = image.getGraphics();

	paintComponent(graphics);
	gr.drawImage(image, 0, 0, null);
	repaint();

}

public void paintComponent(Graphics gr) {
	player1.update(1);
	player1.draw(gr);
	player2.update(2);
	player2.draw(gr);

}[/code]

I googled it and it said because of my connection the images may take a better deal of time to load. Would this be a problem? If so, how can I get it to load faster?

Read full topic

item.title: Application background won't load
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

Since you are using setBackground you need to know a bit about how a component paints. First the paint() method is called and that calls other methods which paint the background then the component then the borders. So it seems like you have overridden this method and so prevent the call to the method that paints the background.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13

}[/code]

item.title: Application background won't load
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I am creating a game but the background of the application will not change. I have set it up to load black and load images, but it stays the default color of gray. Here is the method:

[code] public BulletWarsMain() {
setTitle(“Bullet Wars - 2D - Version 1.0”);
setResizable(false);
addKeyListener(this);
setSize(500, 300);
setBackground(Color.BLACK);
setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);

	setVisible(true);
	
	player1 = new PlayerHandler(10, 150, 20, 90, 10, "Images/p1.gif");
	player2= new PlayerHandler(290, 150, 20, 90, 10, "Images/p2.gif");
}[/code]

Nothing has anything to do with the color except

setBackground(Color.BLACK);

and

player1 = new PlayerHandler(10, 150, 20, 90, 10, "Images/p1.gif"); player2= new PlayerHandler(290, 150, 20, 90, 10, "Images/p2.gif");

which grabs the image…and this loads it:

[code] public void colorComponents(Graphics gr) {
player1.draw(gr);
player1.update(1);
player2.update(2);
player2.draw(gr);

}[/code]

Incase you’re wondering if I am following a YouTube video about this, yes I am. It still won’t fill in the background.

If you need any more code or have questions, ask.

Read full topic
